message: The King's Speech. I really liked True Grit, but then I saw this. It's just terrific, and timeless- it'll still be a fantastic movie 20 years from now.
Yeah, King's Speech was really good. Haven't seen True Grit, yet, though, so I can't say if KS is my favorite movie of the past year.
Only other nominees I've seen are Toy Story 3 and The Social Network

I liked the Economist's criticism of King's Speech. I think Inception should win just for pulling off something so innovative, epic and cinematic. Posted the smae to "Social Network" topic. King's Speech may have a great script and acting. But what about the the art direction and the music? Is it innovating? Is it making use of all that cinema can bring to the table? I haven't seen the movie but I haven't heard anyone talking about those elements. I assume it's not doing those things. I back Inception for best picture. I thought True Grit was fucking great too -- more interesting to me than No Country for Old Men. But Inception was really just firing on all cylinders.
Jeff Bridges should probably win best actor again. Hahah, that may be going to far but.. he was awesome.

I agree with many of your points, but really you can't compare them to King's Speech until you've seen it - it's really masterful. My biggest problem with Social Network as a total movie is that Eisenberg's himself is tight and contained, and he played a tight, contained character. Definitely not a best actor performance. Inception was so creative, so out-of-the-box, that it deserves to win something. Bridges as Rooster Cogburn was my favorite until I saw Colin Firth in King's Speech.
I didnt see King speech.. but I vote for Inception =)
Hahaha "I ain't no tailor but I know what suits me."
